alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 01 at 7:08AM CST until February 02 at 12:28AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. For the Tres Palacios River...including Midfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tres Palacios River near Midfield. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water spills into the flood plain on the right upstream bank and covers the meander point at the meander curve. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 24.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 09/16/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Tres Palacios River Midfield 24.0 23.7 Tue 6 am CST 19.1 9.3 5.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM CST.
